item.title: Binary
item.description: The binary serializer uses the .NET binary serializer formatters to serialize the objects.

item.title: Json
item.description: The JsonSerializer is implemented in a separate assembly because it uses Json.Net under the hood. Customizing configuration The JsonSerializationConfiguration enables support for customizing the configuration used while (de)serializing. Below is an example Using Bson instead of Json To use Bson instead of Json, use the JsonSerializationConfiguration class: var configuration = new JsonSerializationConfiguration { UseBson = true }; jsonSerializer.Serialize(myObject, configuration); Specifying the culture to use during (de)serialization To specify the culture to use during (de)serialization, set the Culture property on the configuration class:

item.title: Xml
item.description: The xml serializer uses the DataContractSerializer from .NET to serialize the object graphs.
